intro: Stanleyella wrightii, commonly known as Wright's Stanleyella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a slender stem, finely divided leaves, and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
